com.desperate.common.replies

Class SessionKeyReplyMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.desperate.common.Message
      • com.desperate.common.replies.ReplyMessage
        • com.desperate.common.replies.SessionKeyReplyMessage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class SessionKeyReplyMessage
extends ReplyMessage
    In the "Needham-Shroeder revisited" method lectured, represents the reply that KDC sends to A to get a session key to talk with B. Comes ciphered with A's Key Encryption Key.
    Author:
    SIRS-RAR
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getStringToHMAC

        public java.lang.String getStringToHMAC()
        Description copied from class: Message
        Gets a string representative of the whole message, to be hashed with Message.computeHMAC(String). The hash will assure the integrity of this info, and nothing else.

        This should include the timestamp. It's up to the subclass to implement this correctly.

        Specified by:
        getStringToHMAC in class Message
        Returns:
        String with all info that needs integrity check
